meanings.definition: To reduce (food or other material) to pulp.
meanings.sent1: She pulped the apples to make applesauce.
meanings.sent2: The blender pulped the tomatoes for the sauce.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally pulped the bananas into a mushy mess.
meanings.sent4: The machine pulped the paper into fine fibers.
meanings.sent5: The chef pulped the vegetables into a smooth puree.

meanings.sent1: The factory pulped the wood to create paper.
meanings.sent2: She pulped the old newspapers for recycling.
meanings.sent3: The artist pulped the paper to form a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent4: The machine pulped the cloth into a soft material.
meanings.sent5: He pulped the cardboard to use as a base for his project.

meanings.sent1: She pulped the oranges to extract the juice.
meanings.sent2: He pulped the grapes to make seedless jam.
meanings.sent3: The chef pulped the lemons to prepare lemonade.
meanings.sent4: The machine pulped the berries to separate the seeds.
meanings.sent5: They pulped the mangoes to create a smooth puree.
